summary: This is an email chain from August 21, 2019, regarding an update to the victim website for the Jeffrey Epstein case. It announces a court hearing scheduled for August 27, 2019, before Judge Richard M. Berman, to address the proposed nolle prosequi order following Epstein's death, and provides a link to the Department of Justice victim services page.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased defendant in the criminal case United States v. Jeffrey Epstein. The email discusses the proposed nolle prosequi order following his death.

persons.name: Richard M. Berman
persons.context: The Honorable Judge presiding over the case in the Southern District of New York. The hearing is scheduled to be held before him in Courtroom 17B.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the email from the Southern District of New York, requesting an update to the victim website and providing details about the upcoming hearing.

connections.description: Judge Berman is the presiding judge over the criminal case United States v. Jeffrey Epstein.
The Assistant U.S. Attorney is prosecuting the case against Jeffrey Epstein on behalf of the United States.

events.title: Proposed Nolle Prosequi Order
events.description: The United States Attorney proposed a nolle prosequi order to the Court, seeking to drop the charges following the death of defendant Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Court Hearing on Nolle Prosequi
events.description: A hearing is scheduled before Judge Richard M. Berman regarding the proposed nolle prosequi order. Counsel for the victims and the victims themselves will be heard.

locations: Daniel Patrick Moynihan United States Courthouse, 500 Pearl Street, New York, New York
keyFacts: A hearing was ordered for August 27, 2019, in the case United States v. Jeffrey Epstein to address the proposed nolle prosequi (dropping of charges) following Epstein's death.
The hearing would allow counsel for the victims and the victims themselves to be heard before Judge Richard M. Berman.
The correspondence includes a link to the official Department of Justice victim and witness services page for the Epstein case.
The document is an internal email regarding updating a victim information website, showing procedural steps taken after Epstein's death.
